SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller.threads

Class GameThread

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.threads.GameThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class GameThread extends Thread
GameThread Class, used to manage the thread-side logic for the controller. Instantiate a new thread for each game to work simultaneously with the same server. It manages the turns and the game flow.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameThread

      public GameThread(BlockingQueue<ThreadMessage> messageQueue, Map<String,WaitState> turnMap, Integer playerCount)
      Constructor of GameThread
      Parameters:
      messageQueue - the queue of messages to be processed by the thread.
      turnMap - the map of players and their turn status.
      playerCount - the maximum number of players in the game.

  • Method Details

    • getGameState

      public GameState getGameState()
      Getter for the game state.
      Returns:
      the current game state.

    • getPlayers

      public List<String> getPlayers()
      Getter for the players in the game.
      Returns:
      the list of players in the game.

    • run

      public void run()
      Run method of the thread, it manages the game loop.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

    • gameLoop

      public void gameLoop()
      GameLoop method, manages the game state and the game flow. It determines the game state and calls the appropriate method in GameThread. It is a loop that runs until the game is stopped.

    • gameLobby

      public void gameLobby()
      GameLobby method, manages the game lobby state. It waits for the game to be full and then changes the gameState to SETUP. It creates a new thread to manage the lobby and a timer thread to delete the lobby if it is empty for more than 10 minutes.

    • setup

      public void setup()
      Setup method, manages the game setup state. It waits for all players to choose their personal objectives, colors and starting cards.

    • mainGame

      public void mainGame()
      MainGame method, manages the main game state. It waits for all players to place a card and draw a card. It repeats until a player reaches the ending score or the cards are over. It calls the playerTurn method for each player.

    • standby

      public void standby()
      Standby method, manages the standby state. It waits for a minute to check if there is only one player online. If there is only one player online, it changes the gameState to ENDGAME.

    • playerTurn

      public boolean playerTurn(String playerName)
      PlayerTurn method, manages the player turn. It waits for the player to place a card and draw a card.
      Parameters:
      playerName - the name of the player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      true if the player has reached the ending score, false otherwise.

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      EndGame method, manages the end game state. It waits for all players to finish their turns, then calculates the final score of each player and sends it to the clients.

    • gameStop

      public void gameStop()
      Initiates the process to stop the game, updates player states, and processes messages until timeout.

      This method sets the game state to end for all players, starts a new thread to process incoming messages, and waits for a specified duration before stopping message processing. During this time, it responds to messages of type "get" and logs errors for other message types.

    • sendUpdate

      public void sendUpdate()
      Sends game state updates to players based on the current player and their respective states.

      This method updates the turnMap for each player in the game, indicating whether each player needs a turn update or a general game state update.

      If currentPlayer is not null, it sets its corresponding entry in turnMap to TURN_UPDATE. All other players have their entries set to UPDATE.
